snippet: The outcome was a measure of strength for Mitt Romney and a test for challengers seeking a strong performance to propel them into the South Carolina primary.
abstract: Mitt Romney wins the Republican presidential primary in New Hampshire, turning back ferocious assault from rivals who sought to disqualify him in the eyes of conservatives; wins by double-digit margin that validates his strategy; candidates who had hoped to use the primary to emerge as his leading rival fared poorly, leaving a fractured Republican opposition.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Trip Gabriel and Nicholas Confessore in Manchester, N.H., and Dalia Sussman and Allison Kopicki in New York.

lead_paragraph: The outcome was a measure of strength for Mitt Romney and a test for challengers seeking a strong performance to propel them into the South Carolina primary.

headline.sub: No Opponents Drop Out as Race Moves to South Carolina
headline.main: Romney Wins G.O.P. Primary in New Hampshire
headline.print_headline: Romney Is Winner In New Hampshire Blunting Attacks
